front.title: Disaggregated Media in the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP)

abstract.t: Disaggregated media refers to the ability for a user to create amultimedia session combining different media streams, coming fromdifferent devices under his or her control, so that they are treatedby the far end of the session as a single media session. Thisdocument lists several use cases that involve disaggregated media inSIP. Additionally, this document analyzes what types ofdisaggregated media can be implemented using existing protocolmechanisms, and the pros and cons of using each of those mechanisms.Finally, this document describes scenarios that are not covered bycurrent mechanisms and proposes new IETF work to cover them.
